meanings.definition: A formal indication of a choice between two or more candidates or courses of action, expressed typically through a ballot or a show of hands.
meanings.sent1: During the election, each citizen casts their votes for the candidate they believe will do the best job.
meanings.sent2: The votes were counted carefully to determine the winner of the competition.
meanings.sent3: In a funny twist, the cat received the most votes for president in the class election.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a thousand votes of confidence, brightening up the room.
meanings.sent5: The power of votes can shape the future of a nation.

meanings.definition: The collective opinion or judgment of a group of people.
meanings.sent1: The votes of the jury members were unanimous in declaring the defendant guilty.
meanings.sent2: Public votes on social media platforms can influence popular opinion.
meanings.sent3: The dog's votes on which treat to choose were always predictable.
meanings.sent4: The thunderous applause was a clear vote of support for the talented performer.
meanings.sent5: The votes of the audience determined the winner of the singing competition.
